image_1.description: Buckingham Palace is a significant location in London, known for the changing of the guard ceremony.
image_1.reason: The image clearly shows a soldier in traditional ceremonial attire at Buckingham Palace during the changing of the guard ceremony. The text mentions that the ceremony was scaled back due to extreme heat, which aligns with the visual content of the image where a soldier is being assisted by a security officer due to heat-related distress.

image_2.description: Dalí was an influential Pop artist who transformed ordinary objects into imposing sculptures.
image_2.reason: The image features three large-scale sculptures by Claes Oldenburg, which are described in the text as transforming ordinary objects into extraordinary and imposing art pieces. The text also mentions that Dalí was an influential Pop artist who did similar work.

image_4.description: The secret behind an elephant’s ability to do many feats of flexibility and force may be found right on its nose.
image_4.reason: The image clearly shows an elephant with a curled trunk, which aligns with the description of 'The Tools in the Trunk' from the text. The text discusses the unique abilities of an elephant's trunk, which is prominently featured in the image.

image_5.description: Chinelo Okparanta is an author of color who uses satire and surrealism to explore racism in her recent books.
